content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
### Steam Power Generation System (Boiler Zone) at (8.0, 20.5)
Consists of the following entities:
- Boiler at (8.0, 20.5)
 – Role: Generates high‐pressure steam for power conversion
 – Status: NO_FUEL; Warnings: ["out of fuel"]
- Steam Engine at (11.5, 18.5)
 – Energy: 11633.333333367; Status: NOT_CONNECTED; Warnings: ["no input liquid", "no fluid present in connections"]
- Steam Engine at (0.5, 9.5)
 – Status: NOT_CONNECTED; Warnings: ["not connected to power network", "no input liquid", "no fluid present in connections"]

### Iron Ore Mining Operation at (-15.0, -50.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at (-15.0, -50.0)
 – Role: Extracts iron ore
 – Status: NO_FUEL; Warnings: ["out of fuel"]
- Burner Inserter at (-14.5, -52.5)
 – Role: Transfers extracted ore
 – Status: NO_FUEL; Warnings: ["out of fuel"]

 – Role: Transfers extracted ore
 – Status: NO_FUEL; Warnings: ["out of fuel"]

 – Role: Moves ore from extraction point
 – Fuel: {'coal': 4}; Status: WAITING_FOR_SOURCE_ITEMS; Warnings: ["out of fuel"]

Consists of the following entity:
- Lab (electrical_id=17999)
 – Role: Conducts research using science packs
 – Lab input: {'automation-science-pack': 12}; Status: NO_RESEARCH_IN_PROGRESS

### Transport Belt Network (Infrastructure)
Consists of the following belt groups:
- BeltGroup with input Belt at (-13.5, -49.5) and output Belt at (3.5, -2.5)
 – Contains 73 belts
- BeltGroup with input Belt at (-11.5, -47.5) and output Belt at (-9.5, -46.5)
 – Contains 4 belts
- BeltGroup with inputs from Belts at (-11.5, -44.5), (-5.5, -24.5), (-6.5, -1.5) and outputs at (1.5, -1.5) and (1.5, -2.5)
 – Contains 97 belts
- BeltGroup with input Belt at (-14.5, -25.5) and output Belt at (-7.5, -26.5)
 – Contains 9 belts
- BeltGroup with input Belt at (-14.5, -24.5) and output Belt at (-6.5, -25.5)
 – Contains 10 belts

### Electricity Distribution Network (Infrastructure)
Consists of the following entity:
- ElectricityGroup (id=17999)
 – Voltage: 33
 – Contains poles at positions (7.5, 5.5), (8.5, 5.5), (8.5, 7.5), …, (14.5, 10.5), (9.5, 15.5)

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
• WoodenChest Placement in Obstructed Zones  
 – Clear candidate tiles manually before attempting placement to avoid repetitive obstruction errors.
• Redundant Placement Attempts  
 – Verify the existence of a structure before initiating a placement action.
• Inconsistent Candidate Zone Selection  
 – Refine detection logic to differentiate critical structures from removable clutter.
• Incorrect Invocation of Position Object  
 – Access the properties of Position directly rather than invoking them as functions.
• Inventory Constructor Usage Error  
 – Pass only the defined parameters to Inventory.__init__() to ensure proper instantiation.
• Fuel Insufficiency for Burner-based Entities  
 – Ensure burner mining drills, inserters, and furnaces receive adequate fuel to prevent “out of fuel” warnings.
• Power Network Connection Issues  
 – Confirm that steam engines are properly connected to the power network and that sufficient input liquid is supplied.
• Furnace Ingredient Deficiency  
 – Supply necessary raw materials to furnaces to avoid “no ingredients to smelt” warnings.
• Risky Automated Clearance Operations  
 – Verify the importance of nearby entities before automated removal to prevent collateral damage.
• Inconsistent Execution Log References  
 – Maintain consistent and accurate step numbering to avoid confusion in log inspection.
• Repetitive Log Summaries  
 – Avoid reprinting the same execution log multiple times, ensuring each step is logged only once.
• Entity Data Formatting Issues  
 – Verify proper formatting of entity neighbor and position data to maintain clarity.

NAMESPACE
────────────────────────────
get_connection_amount(boiler: Entity, extra_se: Entity, connection_type: Prototype) -> int  
 – Determines the required number of pipes to connect two entities; raises an exception if connectivity or spatial conditions are not met.

place_entity(entity_type: Prototype, position: Position, direction: Direction) -> Entity  
 – Attempts to place an entity at a specified position and orientation; fails if the tile is occupied or necessary items are missing in inventory.

craft_item(item: Prototype, quantity: int) -> int  
 – Initiates crafting for a specified item and quantity; throws an exception if essential ingredients or an operational production facility is missing.

get_entity(entity_name: str, position: Position) -> Entity  
 – Retrieves an entity from the map at the given position that matches the specified name; used to verify placement outcomes.

Important Variables:
• inventory: dict[str, int] — Represents the current inventory.
• boiler: Entity — Refers to the boiler at (8.0, 20.5).
• extra_se: Entity — Denotes the extra steam engine at (11.5, 18.5).
• new_buildable_area: BuildableArea — Utility used to determine available buildable regions.
